title: VCSO: Man with missing kids in stolen car rams patrol cruiser
content: A man attempted to hide in bushes off I-4 after being caught driving a stolen car with two missing children inside, authorities said.    Authorities said the stolen vehicle Jervaughn Bonner, 26, was driving was captured by a license plate reader on International Speedway Boulevard in Daytona Beach Saturday.          According to deputies, they found Bonner at a red light, and pulled alongside of the car. Deputies said they told him to put his hands in the air, but when he looked at them Bonner took off and rammed one of the patrol cars in the process.    At the time, authorities said they did not know there were two children in the vehicle with him.    Stop sticks were deployed in an attempt to stop Bonner, but the man continued driving at between 80 and 100 mph with deflated driver's side tires, according to authorities.  Bonner hit another set of stop sticks near Tomoka Farms, deflating his other set of tires, authorities said.    He continued to drive onto I-4 but hit a guardrail. Authorities said he pulled into a median after one of his wheel's began throwing sparks.    A report said Bonner and a 15-year-old girl ran from the vehicle. The girl was pulled from a bush by a deputy who saw her trying to hide and put into a patrol car.    Bonner was found by a K-9 and apprehended. Authorities said he was treated at Halifax Health Medical Center for injuries inflicted by the K-9.    Deputies said Bonner told them he didn't think the dog would find him.    Authorities found a 4-year-old in the front seat of the stolen vehicle without a child restraint seat or a seat belt. The child was turned over to the Department of Children and Families, while the 15-year-old was returned to her mother.    Bonner faces multiple charges including child abuse grand theft auto and aggravated battery on a law enforcement officer.    Neither child was injured.
